page.title: 15VISIT-NETHERLEY FARM,CRADLEY
page.content: The farm is divided into 2 parts.One part is limestone and the other sandstone.The limestone area is used for grazing and some is woodland.There are 800 ewes and 20 rams.The farmer hopes that each year the ewes will produce 1300 lambs.Each lamb will be sold for Â£40.The sheep are Cole Bred and Suffolk.Also they keep cattle on the farm for meat.They have mostly Fresian and Holstein.They spend their whole lives in barns.On the sandstone side,wheat,barley and oats are grown, also swede which will feed the sheep and maize for corn on the cob.The wheat is grown to make bread.Barley is for cattle feed.Oats are grown for sheep feed.There are six tractors and one combine-harvester.Only four men are needed to work on this huge farm,which is about 400 acres.
